name: Hotel & Restaurant Guancascos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a great stay at Hotel Guancascos. For about $22 a night, we spent 2 nights in a tidy, attractively finished room on a hill slightly above Gracias tastefully enclosed by tropical gardens. The rooms were bright and stayed cool during the hot days, and it was nice to have a comfortable bathroom with hot water in the shower. The restaurant is a good place to run into other travelers and overlook the town, and the central location means there are enough restaurants, comedors, and basic needs nearby. Frony, the Dutch owner of the hotel, is a great resource too. She is fluent in English and Spanish (and I imagine Dutch, though I don't know what else!). She started a school in the area some years ago, and she knows everyone. She helped me and my wife arrange a two day trip in the middle of our stay to Celaque, providing a guide, transportation to and from, entrance fees, and the gear (tent, rain cover, sleeping bags, pot, utensils, butane stove) for a reasonable price. ($100 for everything / less per person if you have more people / a good deal when you consider all the costs for gear, entry, transportation, and the guide). Anyway, if you're going to Gracias, you're probably going to Celaque, which is a stunning, dramatic park of high peaks, varied forests (pine, liquid amber, cloud forest, scrub), strange vistas, waterfalls, and the like. Gauncascs makes an excellent stopping point for all of that.
reviews.title: Best choice in Gracias and for Celaque

reviews.text: I have been to this hotel twice and I realised they are making a lot of improvements, They are trying to get a sustainable tourism certification, and rooms have been improved. They have no air in the rooms but I think for Gracias a fan is enough. The restaurnat in the hotel is quite good and I love the gardens inside the hotel and the view is awesome.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: Hotel Guancascos is a nice place, unless something goes wrong. I was there for about a week. First they put me in a room on the top floor, above the bar/restaurant, and everything was fine. But when I left the town of Gracias and then returned, they put me in room #7 under the bar/restaurant, and that's when things began to go very badly.
reviews.title: Nice place...until something goes wrong

reviews.text: The bar/restaurant has a tile floor and wrought iron furniture, and at no time did anyone warn me that every time a patron or employee in the bar/restaurant moved a chair it would make a sharp, loud grinding sound in my room - though it later became clear that hotel employees and the owner were aware of the problem.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations

reviews.text: I was tired and wanted to go to sleep early, but t was impossible to sleep while the bar/restaurant was open. It was scheduled to close at 10 p.m., so I waited it out until then. At 10:15 p.m. I went upstairs and asked politely when the bar/restaurant would close. "Very soon," the employee said as she poured a fresh drink for a patron.
reviews.title: Great place, next to being at home

reviews.text: Guancascos is wonderful, Our room was on the top floor overlooking the city. We had a hammock to relax in right outside of the room. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and clean as well. We had many of our meals at the hotel, the food was really good. I will stay here the next trip to Honduras.
reviews.title: This is the best place to stay in Gracias

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value, enjoyed day trips to La Campa and Santa Rosa anda fantastic hike in Celaque with an expert guide arranged by the hotel.
reviews.title: Another great visit!

reviews.text: If you travel in a developing country, don't expect 5 star. At Guancascos we didn't find 5 stars, but we found everything else.
reviews.title: One of the best, anywhere.......................

reviews.text: We were there for only 3 nights on a road trip (aren't the chicken buses an adventure in their own right!) and wished we had longer. We were met with warm friendly staff, clean compact and very comfortable rooms, and some of the best views anywhere.
reviews.title: Good location, best option in Gracias. Shame about the service.

reviews.text: The food is fabulous, and the restaurant is popular with locals too, so it can't be overly expensive by Hondureno standards, certainly not by ours. And the view from the terrace down over the town of Gracias is wonderful.
reviews.title: Ok overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in April 2012 for 2 nights. After a long and tiring bus journey from El Salvador, we arrived at approx 5pm on a rainy, dark evening, after taking 6 buses and not eating all day. Needless to say we were feeling shattered!
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were shown to our room at the hotel which was heaven-sent. A clean, double bed with a private bathroom and shower for 450 lempiras (about £15). Free, ice cold drinking water right outside the room. Plus a hammock and some comfy chairs for sitting on. We weren't overly impressed with first sights of Gracias (and it was raining) so we headed upstairs to the restaurant with its lovely views over the town. Had a hearty pasta and a cold beer which was just perfect for what we needed!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, best in town.

reviews.text: We stayed in room 14 which was underneath the bar, and had no problems of the noise which some other reviewers had spoken of. We were there at a very quiet time - there was us and only one other couple staying there, but we weren't kept up at all. Infact we had 2 great sleeps there. There was a bit of outside noise from the street but nothing to worry about too much. The only noise I heard was the scraping of the chairs from the restaurant above in the morning as they opened, around 7am.
reviews.title: Lovely views but v noisy

reviews.text: The owner, a Dutch lady (I think?) was very professional and really seems to know how to run a small hotel like this. Overall we were very impressed with the staff there.
reviews.title: Great location but very noisy

reviews.text: Gracias grew on me over the two days I was there. We also visited the hot springs (Termals del Rio) which were lovely, we had the entire place to ourselves. There were hardly any tourists in Gracias, which is a shame as it was definitely a place to wile away a couple of days, although I think a lot of this was because we were so relaxed staying at this hotel. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Overall nice place, but be aware of the noise

reviews.text: Hotel is on a great location near the fort with great views from the restaurant...we ended up eating all of our meals there which were fairly priced...rooms were very well kept...clean and luckily we got rooms away from the bar/restaurant and enjoyed peace & quiet...with hammocks in front of the rooms, it was a nice place to relax...Gracias, on the other hand, was an overrated destination...just a dusty town with too much traffic and some old churches...especially after Suchitoto in El Salvador and Antigua in Guatemala...not worth the detour...but if you must go to Gracias, this hotel will make your visit more enjoyable...
reviews.title: Well kept hotel with great views made up for the over-rated Gracias

reviews.text: This was a lovely hotel..great staff...very helpful, great food and lots to do in the area.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: The rooms were clean , the view was great, the price was right, and the hotel is environmentally friendly. Very rare to find at hotels in this country, but this one is certified.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Gracias

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They recycle and insist guests do too-very good quailty.
reviews.title: incredible view, friendly staff, good food.

reviews.text: My brother and I were staying at a much cheaper hotel 11/13/11 and came to Restaurant Guancascos for a meal and Wi-Fi. Meet some other real nice travelers and took a look at there room and was sold. Singles, double or triple beds in a very decent size room. 540 Lempira for a double room. good views
reviews.title: Best Overall Value in Gracias, Lempira

description: We are located in an old coffee farm on the hill side of the San Cristobal Castle in the center of the colonial city of Gracias. Nice rooms, lush gardens, good food and great views.Hotel Guancascos promotes fair trade and sustainable tourism.
